post.photo-caption: Finally recived my certificate!!! :-D
going up the mast in a freezing cold to change the tricolour lightbulb,Â a couple of days ago…
Gypsy moth aground at uksa
Just finished my exam!!!! And passed my yachtmaster offshore !!!! This calls for some serious celebrations ;-)

post.photo-caption: Top 4 navigation apps for iphone. Even thou personally wouldn’t rely on them too much…
Just got back yestetday from a 5 days non-stop mile building a round the channel and south west coast …763NM … Intense!
Clearing The buildges from diesel and water …
Galley Duty today, unfortunatelly just as we got out of the Solent, the donkey ( engine) started to have some probls, so we are now back in Cowes to sort it out…
Time to go on whirlwind (23 m 12 of crew including skipper and first mate) sounds like we’ll be heading to Dublin:)
VHF radio certificate today
Back at UKSA….
Crossing the channel ( yesterday)
Leaving Cherbourg yesterday
Cherbourg in the morning…
Arrived in Cherbourg after 12hour passage,( 20:00 06-01-12) meal in cherbourg, and now of to bed as leaving at 05:00 to get back to cowes…

Pilotage out of portsmouth, into scherbourg and cross channel passage planning,Everything ready for an early start tomorrow morning for the last 60 mile passage… But plans might change tomorrow, depending on weather ;-)
Portsmouth ( once again ) after a day of skills and drills :)

post.audio-caption: Sound of the wind tonight in portsmouth …Force 8/9

post.photo-caption: Back to UKSA, of to a windy rainy Gray cloudy morning( and most likely next couple of days too)
Winter wonderland last night in hydepark
Revising knots …Â
Sorting out my stuff in my old room, found this kids story from my childhood :-)

Great Christmas present from my brother :)

with engraved poem

————————————–

The Road Not Taken

Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth;

Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim Because it was grassy and wanted wear, Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same,

And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I marked the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way I doubted if I should ever come back.

I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I, I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference.

Robert Frost
Christmas lunch :)
Walk pre-lunch today a round 11:00…
24th dinner, main: “cappon magro” ( Genoa recipe) & stuffed salmon ( Finnish recipe) …
Snow on christmas eve
Got back to my parents house in Italy for christmass break… and is already snowing :-)
Had first aid course today and now of to London for christams/new years break :-) back here on the 2nd of January 2012
Sea survival today, (unfortunately didn’t manage to take pics while we where doing the drills in the pool..)
Something to 8 this morning ….
Not long till Christmas …
Diesel engine course today, took a part a lift pump :)

Today we did a bit of revision of lights and sound shapes to identify ships at night, and at one point I realised how the mental process i you do to make out informations about the ship from the light is very similar from “feurestein method” “organiz
2nd day of simulation, not quiet like a videogame but good fun :)
Freezing cold today, temperature has dropped from an average of 10 in previous weeks to 4
1st day of radar simulation in the transas suit

post.video-caption: Just as the wind picks up to 46 knots..

post.photo-caption: Going under the bridge in the itching river
Double rainbow :)
Expecting gale 9 force 10 winds soon, despite looking good now…
On the way back from lyiminghton to cowes, wind force 7 gusting 8 and a bit of rain, that’s what I call winter.
Just skippered a nice rainy sail into lyiminghton from cowes with force 7/8 wind…now,lunch time
Fishbourne
The calm after the storm…
“Self portrait” earlier on at the nedels today
Bangers and mash
Walk to the needles to check out what a force 9 does to the waves…

Another crew had their storm gib ready to go ( orange sail fold up at the bow) and as soon as they left they where told to come back, so here they are sipping tea in the cockpit in their full weather gear… LoL
Moved on to a new boat for self-skippering week, hower there’s a force 9 now so we ain’t going anywhere for the time being…

After spending half a day to look for a polo t-shirt (as apparently ur supposed to have a picture in a sailing cv) and couldn’t find it as they are well out of season lol, ended up going for a good all shirt… And since is freezing cold had to put a
…and Chinese for dinner it is
Gosport high-street wondering a round with the guys to figure out what we are gonna eat for dinner

It’s my birthday today :) - we went out celebrate last night at the anchor in as we don’t know where we’ll be tonight yet(Yarmouth or Portsmouth or Uksa). This morning we did some approaching of mooring buoy under sail , now at anchor in Osborne bay
Christmas air in cowes
In hamblepoint marina changing boat before end of this sea phase…

Finally back in to Portsmouth, today the rig holding the headsail snapped of and we managed to get it sideways on the deck, and use the spinnaker haliard to hold the mast in place… Luckily we were just a round the island on the south side (and not ie Middle of The English channel)
Earlier on today passing trough the needles to go a round the island

Passing by one of three napoleon’s forts that where built in the Solent
Pasta with pesto revisited for cooking on the boat (cooking every left over veg from this seaphase at once in the pot with the pasta :-)

post.video-caption: Calm sea early in the morning (we left a round 5am from Weymouth )

post.photo-caption: Due to The forecast of gale in the next couple of days, we had to shorten our trip from Plymouth to Darnouth
Weymouth in The morning
Weymouth tonight - Plymouth tomorrow
Got signed of the first 60miles skipper passage and 3 as crew, now got one more to do as skipper in this seaphase

post.regular-body:
Back at UKSA to change boat and skipper…

Yesterday our skip has told us about the four stages of learning, in relation to the learning curve in sailing

1-Unconscious Incompetence
ie his 4 years old son going behind the wheel of the car thinking he’ll know what to do.. But then realising he knows nothing about it ..

2- Conscious Incompetence

Understanding the limits of not knowing a certain skill or task and the value of learning it…

3- Conscious Competence

Executing the skill/task still requires concentration to perform

4- Unconscious Competence
Skill mastered and can be performed while multi-tasking

[ http://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Four_stages_of_competence ]

I think there’s definitely some truth there and I can see examples of where that might work but not completely sold on it..seems a bit too simplistic..

post.photo-caption: Wake up after night at anchor in Poole
Just arrived in Poole, anchored outside the channel for the night…soo tired.
Just finished to workout a rough navigation plan for my first 60mile skipper passage. Leaving Darmouth at 08:00 estimated time of arrival in Poole Harbour 22:00…is gonna be a long day…
Leaving falmouth early in the morning…
Overnight in Falmouth, tomorrow back to Dartmouth for another 60miles passage…

post.video-caption:
Close encounter today… pretty cool it made my day :)
They followed us for about an hour!

post.photo-caption: Earlier on today what looks like a palm three in Dartmouth, “almost ” feels like summer LOL
Dartmouth by night, really nice ( sailing boat on the pontoon in the third pic is ours)
Arrived in Darmouth for The Day :)
Finally in exmouth marina
Morning buoy in exmouth, leaving now to the marina

Has been a long 2 Days and is not over yet, This Is the new charter with new skipper,we left uksa yesterday at a round 13:00 ish and got here to exmouth a round 09:00 am this morning with overnight passage, never seen soo many stars soo clearly , and
Apparently uksa just bought two kickass racing boats…here Is the first one arriving …

post.video-caption:
Half day of today after getting the Nav 2 results, we took the keelboat out for a bit of self skippering,since we are up to day skipper practical and yachtmaster theory level…
In the vid motoring up river to Newport to sail back …

post.photo-caption: Day off after exams results today, we took the keelboat up the river.
Passed last exam on chartwork!!!! And that’s the end of Nav 2.
Passed metheorology( it was either pass or fail mark)
Fog morning
Another day of Nav 2 revision while the watersports guys seem to be racing on their dinghies… (11degrees today)
New set of notes for Meteorology exam tomorrow morning
Tea break :)
Weather revision in class with mascotte sitting on top of projector board lol
Code reg exam results: 97%! … RYA passing mark 80% UKSA passing mark 90%…
Revision cards for code regs exam :)

My notes for the code regs exam tomorrow morning :-)

Going back to pen and paper feels a bit like going back to high-school ( that’s how I used to make my revision notes back then especially philosophy, history, and geology once)
But I have to say it has a very positive effect on getting things from short to long term memory.


Any how wish me luck :)
Revising away in my dorm room…
Back to uksa, getting ready for Nav2 revision
Autumn has reached London as well

Revising on the train, I love it when the images word ratio is like in these RYA books.

It be cool if some anthropology and doc films book where like this :-P

End of phase 2 at sea, and third week of 4 months course, Got
dayskipper level signed of by skipper J in logbook, and heading to
London for my day off tomorrow.

will be back here either wensday morning or tomorrow evening.
Group pic by Lee, With skipper J.

post.video-caption:
Heading back to uksa from portsmouth the light was unbelievable :-)

(Music in background is from the radio)

post.photo-caption: Cleaning the keel part 2
Cleaning the keel in Portsmouth
Rainy solent today…
Rainy sailing…
Piloting/navigation under the rain
Lunch break in lyminghton
One wet morning before living UKSA….
Brighton marina in the morning

First skippering from Brighton to portsmouth


Sea pretty rough(at least to my standard )
Skipper J. Decided to let me skipper the passage: pilotage in and out departure and arrival ports as well as ongoing navigation… while others where at the wheel..

Most challenging bit?
Sea sickness, not soo much on deck but down below plotting positions and course to steer…let’s just say it got pretty rough…
Getting ready to leave Brighton in the morning
Finally arrived in Brighton :)
and heading to Brighton
Left poole harbour early this morning …
Pic from yesterday :-)

Arrived in Poole harbour

Rougher weather going out of the Solent,trough the needle’s channel, wave 1.5metres, but due to wind being in opposite direction of tides, so not as bad as if they where due to the tides alone, at least that’s what skipper J sayd, as far as I am concerned was doing just fine then had to run below deck to put back the black cone(when hoisted it signal that your using the engine as well as the sail, and we just switched of the engine do needed to put that away) and got sea sick a fair bit for the rest of the trip… We had Cornish pasty and beans for lunch and guess that didn’t help one bit :)

When I get sea sick I feel much better when I am at the hem/wheel but someone else was feeling more sea sick then me and therefore was at the helm, so this time I had to suck it up …

Moved onto “prime evil” racing boat :)


There’s less space then in avecet(sun odessey 46) and we are sharing cabins, but is a nice and cosy boat as is the skipper’s boat, he uses it for racing …exciting:)

Completed competent crew


Completed competent crew sea phase and got all the bits signed by skipper D, now of to day skipper sea phase :-)

Ps: third pic/page in RYA log book is skipper D.
Another crew doing the mast climb

And… Up the mast :)

To be honest it was pretty scary going up, very nice view once on top(To be fair didn’t wanna risk dropping the iphone so unfortunately no pics from there ) and quiet alright coming down:-)
The anchor inn

Crew “Harrison 7” on “sun odyssey 46” with Skipper D.

From left:
Toby, Jamie, Skipper D, me, Chris.
And Lee is missing as he is taking the picture.

Back to uksa - of to lidl

Got back to uksa, after going trough Southampton and up the humble river, think I’ve never seen soo many yachts in one place as in the humble river…

And now of to lidl to get some vittling for weekend and next week..

Going to try a sea-sickness wrist band today, it’s early stages but they seem to work…

( haven’t been see sick as such, but just a bit of nausea due to my usual acid reflux)

I read that the principles seems to be those of acupuncture, apparently the wrist are the “meridian” for nausea and there this should re-balance them when they are off balance… Don’t know what to make of this explanation yet.

The Skipper suggested it and he sayd “it is worth trying it , but unfortunately that I know,they only work on one person I know and that is my mother in law…” lol

post.quote-text: At the end of the day it doesn’t matter if you get sea-sick during the exam… It matters how you deal with it… it matters how you get on with it.
post.quote-source: Skipper talking about the exam on board of “avocet”(sun odessey 46)

post.photo-caption: Morning in yarmouth - 08:29
Yarmouth on the map
Sailing across the Solent - from east to west
Arrived in Yarmouth for the night
Somewhere exploring up a privately owned river…
Spinnaker tower in Portsmouth

Arrived at gosport, opposite Portsmouth.

Green boat is a dismissed lighthouse that the marina uses for showers and restaurant. Just had a nice warm shower there after a rainy day:)

1st day out sailing!

Didn’t took any pics as it was raining and despite the waterproof case didn’t want to risk losing the iphone overboard…

Also felt slight sea sickness nausea in the afternoon after lunch, but some good old gaviscon did the trick..

Morning we went up the river to new port using the engine, trying reverse, and turning a round manuvers in short space.

Afternoon, we went out and anchored for lunch north east of cowes( see pic) did man over board manuver,Tack and gybe…

Been a long day:)

post.conversation-title: Earlier today the skipper is explain how you fold a rope to put it away
post.conversation-text: Skipper: [...] so you do it from left to right and twist it a bit with your fingers so that it doesn't turn.. Pietro: how about doing it using your elbow? Skipper: that's how women fold their f*** laundry...

conversation.line: [...] so you do it from left to right and twist it a bit with your fingers so that it doesn't turn..
how about doing it using your elbow?
that's how women fold their f*** laundry...

post.photo-caption: …. and Is raining :)
Done 8 required knots, I remember these 3.

An article on the importance of the awareness of the variety of learning styles in the skipper’s book.
Good stuff.

post.photo-caption: First time Cocking dinner on the boat: mash with broccoly and roast… it’s taking a while
Someone in the boat next to ours checking the mast , tomorrow is our turn:-)
Moving on the boat today: we are going trough the inventory checklist… Tomorrow afternoon we should be good to go :)

post.conversation-text: Pietro: can I ask u a stupid question? Skipper: I'll give u a stupid answer...

conversation.line: can I ask u a stupid question?
I'll give u a stupid answer...

post.photo-caption: Cowes, isle of wight…. put tour :)
Right let’s talk about food, generally is alright(think I might be actually loosing weight) but tonight next to the fish pie there was “Italian bread and butter pudding” ….?

post.quote-text: You have to understand principles before you can make any sensible judgment about anything
post.quote-source: Derek - UKSA instructor. Taken out of context, he was talking on the discrepancy between RYA “theoretical world” Training charts, and real world…

post.photo-caption:
First day of Navigation 1
Massive heah-hacke but very interesting…
Day 1 - induction day, starting to see why is a fast-track course, it seems very packed with a lot to do and learn, feel tired already:)

post.link-description:
Finished a sort of portfolio/website where I’ve polished up some of the videos I’ve been working on for the last couple of months
( some still polishing the audio and a bit of Color correction..)

post.photo-caption:
This (White with red stripes) Is one of the boats I’ll be able to sail by the end of the fast track sailing course :-)
I took this picture during the open-day I attended almost two months ago now…

Course starts in two days, monday 17th of october, runs till 1st of february with break for Christmas and new years :-)

Can’t wait!

post.question: WHAT IS YOUR EARLIEST HUMAN MEMORY?
